trans-unit.source: Specifies the values that define a Peer <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref> object.
A <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud> is a set of nodes that can communicate with each other through the network.
Cloud, peer mesh, and peer-to-peer graph are synonymous.
A single peer or node may be connected to more than one cloud.
Communication between nodes should never cross from one cloud to another.
A <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud> instance is uniquely identified by its name, which is case-sensitive.
Clouds are tied very closely to network interfaces.
On a multi-homed machine with two network cards attached to different subnets, three clouds will be returned: one for each of the link local addresses per interface, and a single global scope cloud.
Initializes a new instance of the PNRP <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref> type.
This populates a serialization information object with the data needed to serialize the Cloud object.
The <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud.Name%2A> property contains the name of the cloud object.
Reference to the object that holds the data needed to deserialize this instance.
Context that provides the means for deserializing the data.
Also referred to as the source of the serialized data.
Returns a reference to a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref> which represents all the link-local clouds in which the client or peer is currently participating.
Use of this property causes a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRegistration> or <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameResolver.Resolve%2A> to occur in all possible link local clouds.
Returns a static reference to a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref> which represents all the available clouds in which the client is currently participating.
This field is used to automatically call <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameRegistration> or <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerNameResolver.Resolve%2A> to on all possible clouds.
Performs a case-sensitive comparison between two cloud objects.
No normalizations are performed on the strings prior to comparison.
All normalization should have been completed at the time the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud> objects were constructed.
The cloud to compare with this <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref>.
`True` if the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref> specified identifies the same resource as the current one, otherwise `false`.
Determines whether the content of this peer <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref> is equivalent to the content of a <xref href="System"></xref> object.
This method inherits the default signature and behavior from <xref:System.Object>.
Other objects that may be compared with <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer> clouds include PeopleNearMe clouds and peer meshes available via the Windows SDK Networking Services.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to compare with this <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref>.
`True` if the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PeerName"></xref> and the comparison object contain the same information; otherwise `false`.
Obtains a collection of peer clouds known to the calling peer.
This method and the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud.GetCloudByName%2A> methods are the only ways to get new instances of the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud> class.
Clouds are tied very closely to network interfaces.

On a multi-homed machine with two network cards attached to different subnets, three clouds will be returned: one for each of the link local addresses per interface, and a single <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud.Global%2A> scope <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud>.
A <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.CloudCollection"></xref> object that specifies a collection of peer clouds known to the calling peer.
If no clouds are available, `null` is returned.
Returns the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref> object with the specified cloud name.
The maximum size of the name is 256 characters.
If the `cloudName` parameter is `null` or empty, then `null` is returned.
The scope of the cloud, <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud.Global%2A>, link-local, or otherwise, is specified in <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud.Scope%2A>.
Contains the name of the PNRP <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref> object with the specified cloud name.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref> name is not known.
Overrides <xref href="System.Object.GetHashCode"></xref>.
Two objects are considered equal if this method returns the same hashcode for both of them.
A hashcode for the current <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
Populates a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization"></xref> information object with the data needed to serialize the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref>.
Holds the serialized data associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref> object.
Contains the destination for the serialized stream associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref> object.
Gets a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref> instance that contains globally (internet) scoped peers.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref> which contains the peers that will communicate via the global network scope.
Gets the name of the peer <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref>.
Names are case sensitive and are Unicode encoded.
They are under 128 characters in length.
The name of the peer <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref>.
Gets the network scope of the peer <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref>.
Clouds are tied very closely to network interfaces.

On a multi-homed machine with two network cards attached to different subnets, three network scopes are possible: one for each of the link local addresses per interface, and a single <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud.Global%2A> scope <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud>.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.PnrpScope"></xref> enumeration value that specifies the PNRP scope of the current peer cloud instance.
Gets the identifier of a specific IP address for this peer <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref>.

On a multi-homed machine with two network cards attached to different subnets, two network scopes are possible: one is a link local <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud.Scope%2A>, and the other is <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud.Global%2A> scope.
An integer value that specifies the scope-specific ID for this peer cloud.
Returns a string representation of the current <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref>.
This method inherits the default signature and behavior from <xref:System.Object>.
A string that represents the current <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref>.
Implements the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable"></xref> interface and returns the data needed to serialize the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref> instance.
Holds the serialized data associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref> object.
Contains the destination for the serialized stream associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Cloud"></xref> object.
